projects.spatial.nodes

Class PRQuadNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.spatial.nodes.PRQuadNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PRQuadBlackNode, PRQuadGrayNode

    public abstract class PRQuadNode
extends java.lang.Object

    PRQuadNode is an abstract class used to provide the common structure that all implementing subclasses will share. It is an abstraction over nodes of a Point-Region (PR)- QuadTree. Consult the lecture slides and the textbook to review the different kinds of nodes in a PR-QuadTree, what they should contain and how they should implement insertion and deletion.

    • Field Detail

      • centroid

        protected KDPoint centroid
        The centroid of the current gray nodes. Its dimensions allow us to direct incoming KDPoints to the appropriate subtree. Invariant: centroid != null

      • insert

        public abstract void insert(KDPoint p)
        Inserts the given point in the subtree rooted at the current nodes.
        Parameters:
        p - A KDPoint.

      • delete

        public abstract PRQuadNode delete(KDPoint p)
        Deletes the given point from the subtree rooted at the current nodes. If the point is not in the subtree, no changes should be performed in the subtree.
        Parameters:
        p - A KDPoint.
        Returns:
        The current subtree, adjusted after the results of deletion.

      • search

        public abstract boolean search(KDPoint p)
        Searches the subtree rooted at the current nodes for the provided KDPoint.
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint to search for.
        Returns:
        true if p was found in the subtree rooted at the current nodes, false otherwise.

      • height

        public abstract int height()
        Return the height of the subtree rooted at the current nodes. The height is defined similarly to AVL trees, as follows:
        1. The height of a null tree (no nodes) is -1 (minus 1).
        2. The height of a tree that consists of a single nodes (a "stub" tree) is 0 (zero).
        3. The height of a tree that consists of four children is the maximum height of its children plus one.

        Note that the data field height is protected, so it's only accessible by derived classes. This is a public method, so it can be called by callers outside the scope of this class (such as PRQuadTree)

        Returns:
        the height of the subtree rooted at the current nodes.
        See Also:
        height()

      • count

        public abstract int count()
        Return the total number of KDPoints contained in the subtree rooted at the current nodes.
        Returns:
        the total number of KDPoints contained in the subtree rooted at the current nodes.
